New Records: Stephen Curry set a new NBA three-pointer record by making all eight of his three-point attempts
Curry became the first person in league history to go at least eight-for-eight on three-pointers and reach double-digit assists in the same game
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry finished with 30 points and 10 assists
Jonathan Kuminga chipped in 20 points off the bench
Draymond Green, Andrew Wiggins and Dennis Schroder scored 15 apiece
Miscellaneous Highlights: Victory improved the Warriorsâ€™ season record to 17-16 while the 76ers fell to 13-19
Others: Elsewhere, defending NBA champions the Boston Celtics sneaked past the Minnesota Timberwolves with a 118-115 win
LeBron James scored 38 points with eight assists and Max Christie added a career-high 28 as the Los Angeles Lakers overcame the Portland Trail Blazers 114-106
The Oklahoma City Thunder extended their lead at the top of the Western Conference with a 116-98 home victory against the LA Clippers
The Brooklyn Nets won 113-110 at at the Milwaukee Bucks and the Indiana Pacers triumphed 128-115 at the Miami Heat
